channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: Scenes from the No Kings Protests
item.description: People gathered for pro-democracy protests across the country today.
item.content:encoded:
People gathered for pro-democracy protests across the country today.

(Image credit: Grant Blankenship)
item.dc:creator: Meredith Nierman

item.title: 2 survivors of suspected drug vessel will be sent to home countries, Trump says
item.description: The two survivors of an American military strike on a suspected drug-carrying vessel in the Caribbean will be sent to Ecuador and Colombia, their home countries, President Trump said.
item.content:encoded:
The two survivors of an American military strike on a suspected drug-carrying vessel in the Caribbean will be sent to Ecuador and Colombia, their home countries, President Trump said.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: These voters want to overturn Missouri's new gerrymandered congressional map
item.description: A Missouri group is working to overturn the map that gives the state one more Republican seat in Congress. If they get enough signatures, the map cannot take effect unless Missourians approve them.
item.content:encoded:
A Missouri group is working to overturn the map that gives the state one more Republican seat in Congress. If they get enough signatures, the map cannot take effect unless Missourians approve them.

(Image credit: Brian Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Savannah Hawley-Bates

item.title: Opinion: Susan Stamberg gave NPR its voice
item.description: NPR has lost a singular, distinctive radio journalist: Susan Stamberg, who died Thursday. She was the first woman to host a national news broadcast and set the tone, pace, and scope of the network.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has lost a singular, distinctive radio journalist: Susan Stamberg, who died Thursday. She was the first woman to host a national news broadcast and set the tone, pace, and scope of the network.

(Image credit: Barry Thumma)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Why are so many rich Americans investing in British soccer teams?
item.description: American millionaires and celebrities are buying up British soccer teams in record numbers.
item.content:encoded:
American millionaires and celebrities are buying up British soccer teams in record numbers.

(Image credit: Jon Super)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: A caregiver's survival guide: Advice from people who've been there
item.description: Family caregivers offer their wit, wisdom and survival tips for the hardest unpaid job in America.
item.content:encoded: Family caregivers offer their wit, wisdom and survival tips for the hardest unpaid job in America.
item.dc:creator: Kat McGowan

item.title: No Kings protests: Marches are underway around the country
item.description: This summer, organizers said more than 5 million people participated in No Kings protests against President Trump. Organizers say they expect an even bigger turnout this time around.
item.content:encoded:
This summer, organizers said more than 5 million people participated in No Kings protests against President Trump. Organizers say they expect an even bigger turnout this time around.

(Image credit: Bill Clark)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: As they go unpaid, Capitol Police are a daily reminder for lawmakers of shutdown pain
item.description: The more than 2,000 officers on the force missed their first full paycheck Oct. 10, leaving them to go without pay at a moment when the officials they protect face growing threats and violence.
item.content:encoded:
The more than 2,000 officers on the force missed their first full paycheck Oct. 10, leaving them to go without pay at a moment when the officials they protect face growing threats and violence.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Does the sale of Dominion Voting Systems mean a transformation? Depends who's asking
item.description: Dominion Voting Systems is at the heart of countless 2020 election conspiracy theories. The company has now been sold, and its new owner has shared contrasting messaging about how much will change.
item.content:encoded:
Dominion Voting Systems is at the heart of countless 2020 election conspiracy theories. The company has now been sold, and its new owner has shared contrasting messaging about how much will change.

(Image credit: Andres Leighton)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: After Zelenskyy meeting, Trump calls on Ukraine and Russia to 'stop where they are' and end the war
item.description: President Donald Trump on Friday called on Kyiv and Moscow to "stop where they are" and end their brutal war following a lengthy White House meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump on Friday called on Kyiv and Moscow to "stop where they are" and end their brutal war following a lengthy White House meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
